title: EU immigration has been awful for British workers
text:
EU immigration has been awful for British workers EU immigration has been awful for British workers A NEW study says that EU migration has been an “economic catastrophe” for the UK costing us about £30billion a year. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Sat, Feb 25, 2017 GETTY EU migration costs the UK £30bn a year, claims study 
That large companies have benefited from our open borders while ordinary people have suffered hardly comes as a revelation but we can be grateful to think tank Global Britain for calculating this important statistic. 
For years this newspaper has been warning of the dangers of unfettered immigration. We have documented how it has devastated public services, overwhelmed housing stocks and caused chaos on our transport systems. Related articles Swedish PM’s swipe at EU as he hints crack down on freedom of movement 
It has grown increasingly obvious too that cheap labour leads to downward pressure on wages and makes it harder for British workers to earn a living. 
All this seemed to pass by the establishment elites who run this country. Business owners were happy with a never-ending supply of cheap labour. 
So too were the wealthy metropolitan types who found it delightful to be able to hire a Lithuanian nanny or a Polish builder. 
They did not care that British working-class communities were struggling. Even after the referendum they have continued to argue that immigration should continue apace. 
Hopefully new research such as that in this report will finally make them realise that this is not a problem that can be brushed under the carpet. 
In Theresa May we have a Prime Minister who has shown that she is dedicated to standing up for British interests by winning back border controls from Brussels. 
This report only confirms the wisdom of her chosen course and the importance of ignoring those who still agitate for open borders. GETTY Paul Nuttall was defeated in the Stoke by-election 
Ukip leader keeps fighting 
UKIP’S Paul Nuttall has reacted to defeat in Stoke-on-Trent by saying he will not stand down and that we have not heard the last of Ukip. Stoke’s support for Brexit meant he had a chance of nicking the seat and giving Labour a bloody nose. 
However, despite overwhelming Euroscepticism in the area, this is not what many would consider a typical Ukip-friendly seat. 
There are plenty of battles ahead and many will be fought on much more favourable ground. 
His defiance will hearten the Ukip faithful and he is right to say that the party has plenty of fight left in it. GETTY Meghan Markle has revealed she was once so hard up for cash she had to enter her car via the boot 
Hardly a golden carriage 
PRINCE Harry’s girlfriend Meghan Markle has revealed that she was once so hard up she couldn’t afford to get her car fixed and had to climb in through the boot. 
One trusts that the footmen ensure she doesn’t have such problems during her stays at Kensington Palace. Related articles
